{"step_by_step_thinking": "Enasidenib is a medication that belongs to a class of drugs called IDH inhibitors. It is specifically approved by the FDA for the treatment of relapsed or refractory acute myeloid leukemia (AML) with an isocitrate dehydrogenase-2 (IDH2) mutation. Therefore, enasidenib can be used for the treatment of acute myeloid leukemia with an IDH2 mutation.", "answer_choice": "A. yes"}
